title: Kerri Stedman shares ectopic pregnancy story in video
text: Source: Ectopic.org.uk With little information regarding the condition at the time, she has decided to share her story to raise awareness. She describes the heartbreaking series of events through writing on cards, in the moving black and white video. She begins: 'Behind each ectopic pregnancy is a woman with a story to tell. This is my story. She tells how she began bleeding on December 9, 2015, just one month after finding out she was pregnant. Two days after, she says: 'I had a scan and was told it was possibly 'ectopic'. I was admitted, not knowing exactly what it was. 'I collapsed and was rushed to theatre. They saved my life. Our baby died,' she wrote. Kerri says she went through a range of emotions from anger to guilt to loneliness. 'There was nowhere to go for support. Just like there is no awareness,' she continued. 'In memory of our baby, we want to change that. 'An ectopic pregnancy is a life-threatening condition. It is the leading cause of death in early pregnancy. 'One in 80 pregnancies are ectopic.' At the end of her video, she adds: 'Please share to raise awareness and maybe save a life! Thank you xxx.' The brave mother is now taking on a 1,000km challenge over the space of 12 months in order to raise awareness for the condition and vital funds for Ectopic Pregnancy Trust Kerri's aim is to get women talking about the symptoms of ectopic pregnancies before it is too late Dozens of women have since commented on the video, praising Kerri for sharing her story, and sharing their own experiences of ectopic pregnancy. The brave mother is now taking on a 1,000km challenge over the space of 12 months in order to raise awareness for the condition and vital funds for Ectopic Pregnancy Trust. Her aim is to get women talking about the symptoms of ectopic pregnancies before it is too late. To support Kerri, visit her JustGiving page here . KERRI'S MESSAGE IN FULL 'Behind each ectopic pregnancy is a woman with a story to tell. This is my story. My name is Kerri. In November 2015 we found out we were pregnant - we were ecstatic. We started planning and preparing for our expanding family. December 9, 2015... I started bleeding. I thought it was a miscarriage. December 11... I had a scan and was told it was possibly 'ectopic'. I was admitted, not knowing exactly what it was. I collapsed and was rushed to theatre. They saved my life. Our baby died. I nearly died. This is all we have left [Kerry holds up a baby scan image] I felt numb. I healed physically from open surgery and the grief hit - Guilt, jealousy, anger, sadness, lonely, helpless, empty. There was nowhere to go for support. Just like there is no awareness. In memory of our baby, we want to change that. An ectopic pregnancy is a life-threatening condition. It is the leading cause of death in early pregnancy. One in 80 pregnancies are ectopic. Symptoms: Missed or late period; Vaginal bleeding; Abdominal pain; Shoulder pain; Bladder/bowel problems; Collapse. Please share to raise awareness and maybe save a life! Thank you xxx.' Read more:
